alert.note: Alert for Canon City Vicinity, Eastern Fremont County; Northwestern Fremont County Above 8500Ft; Teller County, Rampart Range above 7500fT, Pike's Peak Between 7500 And 11000 Ft; Western, Central Fremont County Below 8500 Ft; Wet Mountains between 6300 and 10000Ft (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 15 at 7:01PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Fremont and southern Teller Counties through 745 PM MDT... At 659 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles north of Royal Gorge to 7 miles southwest of Florence. Movement was northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and torrential rainfall with 1 to 2 inches per hour. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Localized flash flooding may be possible in low spots in and around Canon City. Locations impacted include... Florence, Royal Gorge, Canon City and Penrose. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
